item.title: August 15 Will Be a Big or Bad Day for InZOI
item.description:
It’s been a busy summer for life-sim fans. From the recent release of Tales of the Shire to Paralives ’ Early Access launch date announcement, there has been no shortage of new content to either consume or anticipate. And even as the season progresses, the flurry of updates, DLC, and new games is not quite over yet. InZOI will be stepping in soon to deliver some much-anticipated information about its very first DLC on August 15.

On July 28, InZOI shared a teaser trailer for its Island Getaway DLC. Then, Krafton announced that more details would be shared on an August 15 livestream. And while that might seem like a cause for celebration, the pressure on InZOI is already sky-high. With lofty comparisons to The Sims and Paralives , fans have been eagerly awaiting to see whether the game is truly a next-gen sandbox or an ambitious indie sim that simply misses the mark. The August showcase is a pivotal moment for InZOI to prove itself, not just in terms of content, but in how it engages its growing community.

Why InZOI Fans Are Eager to See What Island Getaway Has in Store

InZOI has transparently worn its influences on its sleeve. From its highly detailed mechanics behind creating a Zoi to its free-building features and focus on hyperrealistic visuals, it’s been billed as the next big competitor to The Sims . That alone puts a lot of pressure on its first DLC, especially one themed around a tropical escape. It’s not just new clothes or items players want, but it’s a new rhythm: a slower pace, a setting that lets Zois live yet another digital life.

The Pressure of a First Impression

Island-themed DLC is practically a tradition in the life-sim space, from the foundational The Sims 2: Bon Voyage expansion to the reimagining of a whole franchise like Animal Crossing: New Horizons . But where InZOI differs is in the expectations already placed on it. This isn’t just about pretty beaches or new swimwear. Fan InZOI wish lists are usually extensive, and this DLC is no exception.

That’s because InZOI , in its current state, is gorgeous but a little hollow after some hours of play. InZOI ’s realistic cities and hyperrealistic visuals helped grant it a strong first impression, but many players have noted that gameplay depth hasn’t quite caught up to the visuals. With that in mind, Island Getaway has a lot of work to do. A successful expansion could introduce new aspirations, develop travel mechanics, and flesh out family or social AI. A lackluster one might rely too heavily on aesthetics, leaving players with beautiful scenery but few reasons to engage.

What Fans Want to See

August 15 is a big day for InZOI fans, but their reaction depends on what they see in the official trailer. Fans are seeking meaningful interactions, new event types, family-friendly gameplay loops, and above all, systems that enhance the core experience. Yet, there are some features specific to this kind of DLC that can make or break fan hopes:

  • A travel system that lets Zois vacation or move to an island
  • New social events or festivals unique to the DLC's tropical setting
  • Expanded family interactions like beach bonfires or other kid-friendly activities
  • Crafting systems tied to the island's environment
  • Relationship-specific content (like honeymoons, destination weddings, or friend trips)

None of these features are guaranteed, but they reflect a desire for InZOI to prioritize systems, not just cosmetics. But there’s also the fact that some of the expected features may be too ambitious, given that InZOI is still in Early Access.

If InZOI ’s Island Getaway DLC can introduce even a few new mechanics and integrate them seamlessly into existing gameplay, it will go a long way toward establishing the game as more than just a pretty face.

The Risk of InZOI Missing the Mark on August 15

The life-sim genre keeps getting increasingly competitive. With the InZOI versus The Sims conversation expanding into a triple threat, InZOI must do what it can to ensure it stands out in the face of hefty competition.

Players don’t want a vacation-themed DLC that looks great in screenshots but lacks real depth. Many are still wary of life-sim DLC that leans heavily on decorative items or simple animations rather than fully fleshed-out gameplay systems. With the game still in Early Access and InZOI ’s development roadmap having to push back some milestones, August 15 could either prove the studio’s long-term vision or shake fans’ confidence entirely. Krafton may find itself facing the kind of backlash life-sim developers know all too well.

August 15: A Turning Point for InZOI

Whether August 15 ends up being a celebration or a warning shot, there’s no denying how much hinges on it. InZOI is still early in its lifecycle, but this DLC has the potential to define how players view the game's future. If Island Getaway nails the balance of style and substance, it could cement InZOI ’s status as more than just an aesthetically pleasing alternative to The Sims. If not, it might reveal just how far the game still has to go before it can leave Early Access.

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket's New Trading System Will Change the Game Forever
item.description:
The new Trading system update for Pokemon TCG Pocket will change the feature forever, thanks to the introduction of the wishlist feature and some major improvements. This new update will be accompanied by the release of Wisdom of Sea and Sky, the latest expansion for Pokemon TCG Pocket .

Pokemon TCG Pocket quickly became one of the most successful mobile games of 2024 after its October launch, with over 10 million downloads in just two days. However, the release was not perfect, as trading has been a heavily criticized feature due to the implementation of trade tokens. Many players argued that Trade Tokens were a harsh restriction that dissuaded players from Trading frequently, and after considering player feedback, The Pokemon Company decided to discontinue Trade Tokens with a new Pokemon TCG Pocket update. That long-awaited update will be released on July 29 at 11:00 p.m. PT / July 30 at 2:00 a.m. ET, with crucial adjustments and changes being made to trading.

The Trade feature update for Pokemon TCG Pocket is shaping up to be a game-changer, as it will allow players to set up a Trading wishlist and share which cards they would like to trade with others. Pokemon TCG Pocket players can navigate their wishlists from the My Cards screen, and each wishlist can support up to 20 cards, according to The Pokemon Company. From the cards in their wishlists, players can highlight three cards to display on their profiles to give others an idea of what the player is exactly looking for.

Pokemon TCG Pocket July 30 Update Brings Trading Wishlist Feature and Discontinues Trade Tokens for Good

When coupled with the discontinuation of Trade Tokens, the Trading feature will be streamlined to help players trade for the cards they want. After the update's release, players will no longer need to exchange cards in order to obtain said tokens for the purpose of Trading. Instead, Shinedust will be required for certain rarities of cards in Pokemon TCG Pocket , including three-diamond, four-diamond, and one-star cards. Shinedust can be acquired by completing in-game missions, earning achievements, and obtaining duplicate cards. It should be noted that any remaining Trade Tokens can be exchanged for Shinedust or 60-pack Hourglasses as well.

The long-term effects of the revised Trading system remain to be seen, but the addition of the Trading wishlist feature and removal of Trade Tokens appear to be steps in the right direction. Players will be able to test out these features with an abundance of new cards from Pokemon TCG Pocket's Wisdom of Sea and Sky expansion on July 30. The expansion brings beloved Pokemon native to the Johto region, as previously seen in the Pokemon Gold and Pokemon Silver video games. These Pokemon include Chikorita, Cyndaquil and Totodile, as well as the Legendary Pokemon Lugia and Ho-Oh.

item.title: Pokemon GO Reveals New Hatch Day Event for August 2025
item.description:
Pokemon GO has revealed a new Munchlax Hatch Day for August 2025 with limited bonuses, including reduced hatch distance requirements. Pokemon GO is set to launch multiple exciting events in the coming weeks as its Delightful Days season approaches its big finale.

Since the release of Toxel in 2024, all Baby Pokemon have become available in Pokemon GO . The list of these adorable creatures isn't long, but some Baby Pokemon are harder to catch than others. For this reason, Pokemon GO occasionally launches Hatch Day events that can help players register these monsters in their Pokedex. The last Hatch Day was held in April and featured Tyrogue. Now, the mobile game has announced a new edition for August starring a Gen 4 critter.

Pokemon GO has announced a Munchlax Hatch Day for Saturday, August 9, 2025. The event will run from 11:00 AM to 5:00 PM local time. During this period, Munchlax will hatch more frequently from 2 km Eggs, and players will have an increased chance of hatching its shiny version. Additionally, hatching Pokemon will reward double the amount of Candy, and there will be an increased chance of receiving 2 km Eggs from spinning PokeStops. Finally, from August 7 at 10:00 AM to the end of the event, hatch distance will be reduced by half. It is worth noting that Munchlax's Hatch Day will last for six hours, which is double the length of previous editions. In the past, fans have complained that Pokemon GO Hatch Days were too short to make the most out of the bonuses. It seems that the developers have considered this feedback and adjusted the schedule for the next event.

Pokemon GO Reveals New Munchlax Hatch Day for August 2025

  • Saturday, August 9, 2025, from 11:00 AM to 5:00 PM local time
  • Event Bonuses
    • 2× Candy from hatching Eggs.
    • Players have an increased chance of hatching Shiny Munchlax
    • Increased chance of receiving 2 km Eggs from spinning PokeStops

  • Extended Bonus
    • 1/2 Egg Hatch Distance
    • From Thursday, August 7, at 10:00 AM to Saturday, August 9, 2025, at 5:00 PM

Munchlax's Hatch Day overlaps with Snom's debut in Pokemon GO , and since the Ice-type Pokemon will hatch from 7 km eggs exclusively, the reduced hatch distance bonus could come in handy for players. Moreover, during Hatch Day, special Timed Research will be available with a free Incubator and 5,000 XP as rewards. Players can also purchase a $2 ticket for additional Timed Research tasks that grant double the Stardust, two Supe Incubators, and one Star Piece.

Some major events are coming to Pokemon GO , including the long-awaited debut of Eternatus on August 23 and 24 during GO Fest: Max Finale. The game will also launch Rookidee's Community Day on August 30, after the critter was voted first place in an official fan poll.

item.title: Genshin Impact Leak Teases New Version 6.0 Bosses
item.description:
A recent leak from Genshin Impact is hinting at a pair of new bosses set to be added to the game as part of the Version 6.0 update. The massively popular RPG from HoYoverse offers a variety of different types of challenges for players to tackle throughout the expansive world of Teyvat. Players can challenge Domains to farm everything from leveling materials to Artifacts, while Genshin Impact 's world also plays host to many different bosses to take on. Now, a new leak is hinting at some new bosses for the game's next region.

HoYoverse has given fans plenty to be excited about with the launch of Genshin Impact 's next region just around the corner. The developer has teased a plethora of different locations and groups set to be involved with Nod-Krai's main story, with the locale serving as the first playable section of Snezhnaya. Genshin Impact even teased several characters who will appear within Nod-Krai, including two Fatui Harbingers and the long-rumored Alice. Recent leaks are now teasing a pair of World Bosses being added with Nod-Krai's launch.

Genshin Impact Leak Hints at New Nod-Krai World Bosses

A leak shared by prominent Genshin Impact leaker UTeyvat is giving early teasers for two Nod-Krai world bosses. The leak suggests that the first world boss will be a large robot enemy located in Genshin Impact 's overworld, found not far from Nod-Krai's Nasha Town. The second boss said to appear within the update has a notably more vague description, being a "new type of beast with wings" and found in a cave within Nod-Krai. Both bosses are expected to debut as a part of Genshin Impact 's Version 6.0 update, currently scheduled to launch on September 10.

Genshin Impact 's Version 6.0 is expected to bring a wide range of content to the RPG to celebrate Nod-Krai's launch. HoYoverse has yet to directly confirm which characters will debut during Nod-Krai's release update, though it is expected Version 6.0 will follow previous trends with three new characters. The duration of Version 6.0 will also welcome the fifth anniversary of Genshin Impact 's launch, with HoYoverse not confirming the special rewards for this year's festivities as of yet.

While Genshin Impact fans await the launch of Nod-Krai, Version 5.8 looks set to close out the Natlan cycle with a bang. Version 5.8 will welcome the game's newest summer event with "Sunspray Summer Resort," featuring the first permanently available summer area. The update will also feature Ineffa as the game's newest five-star character and the first member of Genshin Impact 's roster to hail from Nod-Krai. Genshin Impact is gearing up for an exciting second half of the summer with Nod-Krai's official release on the horizon.

item.title: Wildgate: Tips and Tricks for Beginners
item.description:
Wildgate is a unique online multiplayer space race experience that sends you and a team of Prospectors on intergalactic adventures to recover artifacts while facing off against enemy teams. The game contains numerous dynamic features that can take some practice to get the hang of.

Knowing where to start in Wildgate can be a challenge in itself as the game essentially throws you right into the fray, but once you gain an understanding of how everything works, you'll find yourself shaping into a bona fide space pirate in no time.

How to Get Started in Wildgate

When you first boot up Wildgate , you'll want to get yourself familiar with the game's various systems, in terms of equipment loadouts, character customization, the roster of playable Prospectors, and its different modes. In fact, before you do anything else, you'll want to try out the game's tutorial, which you can find by going to the Game Mode menu (above the 'Play' button in the bottom right corner).

The tutorial will walk you through all the fundamentals of a Wildgate match, from how to use your ship's different features to destroying and boarding enemy ships, mining asteroids, recovering Artifacts, and making it into Wildgate portals to secure a victory. This will give you an idea of what to expect when you're ready to dive into multiplayer matches. However, there are still plenty of other gameplay aspects you'll want to be aware of ahead of time.

Beginner Tips for Wildgate

Level Up Your Prospectors

First and foremost, progressing in Wildgate involves leveling each individual Prospector character in the game. They each have their own storyline divided into two chapters. For example, Venture's story is titled 'Adventure: Wonder', and starts with Chapter 1 - Explorer. Meanwhile, Chapter 2 is called 'Curious.'

As you complete matches with Venture as your chosen Prospector, you'll earn XP towards not only various equipment and customization unlocks, but also his overall storyline. Likewise, you can do the same with the game's other Prospectors, and this method of progression encourages players to try out each character thoroughly.

Complete Your Daily Missions

Similar to other online FPS multiplayer games with experience-led progression systems, Wildgate features a list of Daily Missions you can complete every 24 hours to earn a considerable amount of bonus XP toward any chosen Prospector.

These missions revolve around universal tasks done during matches, such as restoring ship parts, destroying and outliving enemy ships, and overloading the reactor on an enemy ship if you're feeling gutsy. Make sure to check these missions each day and complete as many as you can.

Explore Different Match Roles

The tutorial covers this relatively well, but as you go into online matches, you'll notice that there are all manner of things to do besides shooting enemy space pirates. You can venture out to explore the map and discover important locations as well as enemy ships hidden in the distance. You can raid abandoned ships and other locations for loot and artifacts, while also, of course, boarding active enemy ships and doing your best to sabotage their operations.

However, if you prefer to stay close to home, you can focus on piloting and/or maintaining your ship and its defenses when enemy ships attack. Any and all of these tasks reward various amounts of XP, so you don't have to worry about falling too low on the contribution totem pole. While it's optimal to get comfortable with at least a few of these different tasks, if there's a certain role you'd prefer to stick to, that's fine as well.

Flexible Chat Options

While Wildgate is first and foremost an online multiplayer experience, the game still provides a hearty amount of chat customization options that you can adjust according to your level of social comfort. You can adjust your chat settings by going to the Options menu and then to both the 'Audio' and 'Social' tabs.

For example, you can opt to disable voice and text chat outright if you'd prefer to keep things more muted during gameplay. It may seem like this would do nothing more than cripple your ability to communicate with your teammates properly, but the game still includes other features like location pings and in-game messages related to various tasks that help share key information (e.g., "The ship needs more fuel").

Use the Firing Range to Test Weapons

The Firing Range mode in Wildgate is probably one of its most dynamic features, and one that you should definitely try at least once while getting used to the game. Rather than just having you walk up to a counter to shoot some simple targets with a handful of weapons, this Firing Range presents you with all possible means of firepower in the game on a silver platter.

When you first enter the Firing Range, hop out of the ship on the right side to find the platform full of various items (your HUD will ping them with green arrows so you can't miss them). These items include resources you can deposit into your ship, such as Afterburner Fuel, Ice to make Coolant for your ship's reactor, and Ammo for your ship's turrets.

Further in, you can find all types of unique turret weapons that you can further customize your ship with during a match. There are also handheld weapons to try, if you're looking to be more of a raider or boarder on enemy ships.

The Firing Range allows you to test every type of possible weapon there is in the game before you dive into actual matches, so that you're familiar with as many types as possible, as your loadout often depends on what loot you can find in each match.

PvP Combat Can Feel a Bit Unforgiving

The PvP combat in Wildgate is pretty simple in nature, but can still take some practice to get the hang of. If you get ambushed and killed by an enemy on your team's ship, it'll take a little over 10 seconds to respawn. When you do, be aware that there's no invincibility cooldown like in other games that usually allow you a brief moment to re-engage during combat safely.

That isn't the case here, unfortunately, and you'll need to be vigilant the moment you respawn to avoid getting killed in quick succession. Given the very close quarters you have to fight around inside your ship, the lack of an invincibility cooldown does make some sense. However, it also means that PvP combat is more of a learning curve in this game, so make the most of each respawn and also consider the weapons you're using. The more powerful they are, the more likely you are to stay alive.
